IMPORTANT INFORMATION REGARDING REMOTE LEARNING
For the second 9-weeks which starts Monday, October 12, if you are planning on Changing to Remote Learning, staying in Remote Learning, or changing to In-Person Learning, you MUST fill out the online registration. The window to sign up, remain or change starts Monday 9/14 and ends Friday 9/18 at 3 pm.

* All remote learners must fill out the form to remain.
* New remote learners must fill out the form to join.
* Additionally if you wish to leave remote learning, you too must fill out the form!

Registration Form is now Available:
https://www.mauryk12.org/remote_learning

High School Students!!

Blood Assurance needs your help this school year! A special promotion going on for high school students now through December! The winning school will be awarded a trophy and students will receive a special Class of Heroes t-shirt, and they can even be entered to win a Sony PS5!
Blood Assurance has safety is their number one priority. They have implemented extra protocols to ensure the safety of donors and staff. This includes extra cleaning and disinfecting, spacing apart appointments to ensure social distancing, and requiring masks to be worn by all donors and staff. Giving blood is an essential activity and we can’t save lives without your help.
Schedule your appointment by visiting bloodassurance.org/schedule, text BAGIVE to 999777, or call 800-962-0628.
No mask, no problem, Blood Assurance from Aug 25 to 30 has free antimicrobial, reusable, washable breathable masks while supplies last.

HS/EHS is a child development program that provides comprehensive early childhood education, health, nutrition, and parent involvement services to children and their families.
Services include:
- Active learning experiences
- School Readiness
- Qualified Teachers
- Resources and assistance with medical and dental health services
- Family Engagement
- Safe, Licensed Facilities
- Nutritious Meals
- Services for Children with Special Needs
- Pre-natal and Post-natal Education for Pregnant Women and their Families

*EHS serves pregnant women and children from 6 weeks up to 3yrs old. *HS serves children 3-5 yrs old. To apply for HS child must be 3 yrs. old by August 15.

Documents needed to apply:
 Proof of Birth-Text or email
 Proof of Income-Text or email
 Health Insurance cards (optional)- Text or email

Maury County Public Schools Tornado Effort

Middle Tennessee suffered a severe blow yesterday as tornado's ripped through several counties. I am sure your hearts were breaking as much as ours as we watched the reports of the severe devastation and loss of life. We would like to support the tornado relief effort in the Nashville area. We will be doing this in conjunction with the 2nd Annual Maury County STEM Expo which will be held Saturday, March 7th at Central High School.

We are pleased to be partnering with McCanless Trucking in this effort. McCanless Trucking will have a dump truck parked in the teacher parking lot at Central High School. We are asking for cases of water to be donated. We will be collecting the water between 8:00 and 1:00 on Saturday, March 7th. We will get some flyers to your school as soon as we can to help with publicizing this event. Any way you can help us to spread the word will be greatly appreciated!!

Thank you in advance for your support!
Beverly J Miller, Ed.D.
Director of Instruction
Maury County Public Schools

Highland Park Elementary

Highland Park - Gold Status
- Highest level of distinction
- Criteria include the implementation of:
- Tier I, II, & III w/Fidelity
- Individualized support
- Functional Behavior Assessment
- Behavior Support Plans
- Monthly School Level Team Meetings
- Data-driven and problem-solving conversations
- Fine-tuning the school-wide behavior support framework

There are 1800 schools in TN. Only a small percentage meet the Criteria. All schools in the county receive free training from Tennessee Behavior Support Project (TBSP). The ultimate goal of participating in the program is for school to build a supportive, caring school climate, by teaching, re-teaching and reinforcing positive behavior necessary for LIFE.

Happening Tonight, 6:30 pm at Columbia Central High School!

The Maury County Choral Festival

A chance for students all across Maury County to sing and learn together! There are over 325 students from 15 schools participating! We have invited a wonderful musician, Angela Beale, who teaches choir at Franklin High School, to work with the students. Students will spend Friday afternoon, Feb. 28th rehearsing and getting to know each other. The festival concludes with a concert at 6:30 in which parents, friends and more are invited to attend. Each school has the opportunity to perform one piece and the evening will conclude with all the students joining together for three songs led by Ms. Beale. It will be a fun evening of music sharing and community building and we are very excited to have everyone attend! Thank you to Mr. Lang for all his assistance in putting this event together for our students!

Trevor Baxter is with Blair Boothe and 7 others at Columbia Central High School.
February 23 at 12:26 AM · Columbia, TN ·

The 2nd Annual Columbia Winter Showcase on the campus of Columbia Central High School!!!

Thank you to all of the parents and students that gave your time and dedication to the success of CWS. We had 55 groups to perform. It was an electrifying atmosphere and the day flowed really well. Special thanks to Mr. Dan Jaynes “The Voice” for all that you do for the band! Nobody does it better 🎙

The CHS Indoor Percussion Ensemble completed their first full performance of Mystery and Madness: the Music of Beethoven. They were first place in the Percussion Scholastic Concert A Division and improved upon their score from last week 🎉

The CHS Color Guard placed second in the Scholastic AA Division with another stellar show. It is amazing and inspirational to see the improvements our Guard achieve at every performance 🙌🏾

Finally, I would like to thank SCGC for allowing this great event to take part at Columbia Central High School! The Tradition of Excellence is in every aspect of the CHS Band 💜
